revised_title: Flow Dynamics in Exponentially Varying Tubes: An Extension of Daniels and Eagles Theory
tldr: The authors extend the work of Daniels and Eagles to develop a theory for steady, axisymmetric, viscous flow in tubes with locally exponential radii. They modify and expand the Stokes stream function series to accommodate a wide variety of tubes and provide numerical calculations for several terms. The theory has a wide applicability and can be used to predict flow dynamics in tubes with bounded radii and varying shapes.
